text: Last Monday. Alpha.
Just need to slow tags and locations down a bit.
<@U02F9CXTL> Thats what I am looking to compare
Confirming this is the edit we are comparing: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2saO1SetZcbMGpfd2NDU3I1U2M>
<@U0J6TE0CA|emilyskaer> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/emilyskaer/F4DTRGJBF/attractmode_4up_20170228.mp4|AttractMode_4UP_20170228.mp4>
This speed is fine. What we saw Friday was faster. Too fast.
I was under the impression this was too slow?
^ <@U02F9CXTL> ?

Never heard that from last Monday. Friday's push - too fast.
We can adjust but don't want to recommend Friday's push/speed  to client.
<@U02F9CXTL>  Ok, since speed is so manually intense to adjust, why don't we try something different.
How about I do a couple exports of different speeds overall & then when we find a speed that works, we can manually change the keyframes.

The differences is adjusting the speed of an overall composition, (which potentially does not play well with Bodymovin) vs. manually adjusting all the keyframes & finding that the timing does not work.
Ok. <@U0J6TE0CA> hope u are planing to come in tomorrow as well? Would like more insight w keyframes - body moving - speed
<@U02F9CXTL> I'll be there. We need to figure out this speed thing, because the link is one the client said was too slow, but if I am hearing right we are going back to it?
That's fine - again - what we saw Friday was too fast.
Ok let's do speed tests tomorrow, if we don't have a speed nailed down
If you were saying earlier to do exports of speed - want to see these now. Honestly - Friday's push was too fast. That is all.

Suggesting the speed tests now, I was under the impression the client wanted it faster & that Friday's export was too fast so we needed to be somewhere in the middle. What i just read was that we want to revert back to the slower speed. However, if we want something other than these two options, (between the two speeds or the slower speed), we should do speed tests.
Otherwise, we're going to run into not having something to Dev.
Does that work/make sense?
Friday's push was too fast. Please adjust.
Let's just discuss tomorrow, need more specifics
Are the updates finished from Justin's doc? Please send
<@U02F9CXTL> Theres notes on them, tagged you
Just seeing these. Replied.
Please send updates asap
.MOV exports I am assuming? Fair warning: Really at a loss about the timiing.
crashing
Yes .mov same folder.
Please send link to team when finished
<https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/0B2saO1SetZcbM0szcEhhM08xREk>
^ <@U02F9CXTL>
Also <@U0EL0GLEL> here's the Bodymovin for the right flank to test again: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2saO1SetZcbUWRxYmkwWWx4bGc>
<@U0J6TE0CA|emilyskaer> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/emilyskaer/F4D4LV272/rflank_20170304_v2.json|RFlank_20170304_V2.json>
thanks all for the continued push here in crunch time
I don't know whether it's an issue, but wanted to note that the podium motion studies show the home screen with swiping, which has been replaced with buttons, since swipe won't be available
otherwise, podium is looking really good to me

There's been a few design changes in podium since the last versions of the motion study, but Attract mode has become a higher priority. Fortunately, there's motion mock ups of a pressed button in other areas of the podium motion studies.
thanks <@U0J6TE0CA> - does that mean <@U243UT96G> has what she needs based on the pattern we use to navigate stories on the location view?
Mo can verify this, but she showed me last week that the press state 'ripple' for Material is already baked into the work she's doing... If I'm understanding correctly.
Movement of the actual cards is another story
<@U0HP6TFNX> yep! <@U026E0ZNR> I'm out of the loop on this one.
Press state referring to the arrow buttons being used on main screen now. Just tossing in my understanding and confirming
Sure, I just wasn't aware this already
emilyskaer: Ohh myyyy
AUTOCORRECT AUTOCORRECT
Hey dudes I'm sick :mask:.  Do I have to come in?  Could u guys maybe just let me know if it's fucked?
<@U243UT96G> definitely not fucked - looks really good
we'll GVC you in for the 12:30
it's looking increasingly like i'll also need GVC version if you could send that out. Thanks.

motion for the button on podium?
i thought we were doing refinements on podium after beta
i don’t think the matter of animation on press of scroll button is  pressing.  no pun intended
maybe pun intended just a little

<!here|@here> I've been on the rig for couple hours this morning and things look really, really good. Y'all did a ton of work yesterday. I've been filing any issues I can find in Jira, tagging with 'Beta-prep'.  At this point it's minor cosmetic fixes. <@U243UT96G> is looking into one issue around podium rotate, but even that one is a rare path to hit.
Here with joel
perfect, i will be rolling thru the remaining tasks from home today, will join the hangout at 12:30
cool.  <!here|@here>  is jira updated to reflect progress?
I'll be done logging issues here shortly, and then I'm going to prioritize the list. Let's review that together at 12:30 and make plans for fixes before the last drop today.
Thanks Joel! Can you add me as a watcher to those tickets?
sure thing

<@U243UT96G> <@U0EL0GLEL> <@U2670DYLE> Sounds like there were/are some updates since last night that fix a couple things I'm seeing this morning. Let's do a deploy at 11:45 with anything that's done this morning. I'll merge any outstanding pull requests and push to dev. That'll give us some time to review before the 12:30.
speaking of <@U243UT96G> is this accounted for?  <https://uncorkedstudios.atlassian.net/browse/GNC-154>
it is
we don’t have any global stories tho
so on a state level, general e.g. state-wide stories do not show a push pin but we don’t have a way of testing global stories atm.  so keeping story open
could we add some test global stories so we can see an example <@U0B9N0HF0> ?
can it wait til after demo?
can we at least test it today so we know where we stand, so we're not caught by surprise with unknown issues
i think people have their hands full with display updates, we have the rules in place and they should not be hard to implement
I want to look informed in front of clients, even if we're noting that we're aware of bugs
or sorry, maybe I'm not understanding
what's involved in getting the right data in there to test?
do we have rules in jira but not implemented? I was thinking it was coded but untested.
I believe to test, we'd need to add a story to the CMS without a location, with some sort of keyword that allows us to easily identify it and remove it
the thing is that global scope is hard coded atm, because otherwise the test will land on global, for which we have no stories
and peter still has to add the exception for the US, which we discussed

i understand your concern, and we have to intention of handing it off without testing global stories.  i’m just concerned about adding additional untested content at this critical juncture, possibly compromising the beta, when we don’t need to demo with global stories
Ok so the state now is that we know we have some more to do before we support global?

i think I already coded the exception, it seems to me like i have added support for that in the api already, there was a story for nigeria in there and i checked the api against using that location and it was working
dont remember checking it in the front end tho, just the api calls seemed right
Client-relations hat on: Is client aware that we may not be supporting Global stories out the gate? Including what it might take to get it to full-functionality? <@U0B9N0HF0> <@U0ML49XU0> ?
system is suppossed to support global out the gate
we know client might not have global content til post launch but the system is designed in a way to accommodate as soon as they have content

Got it. I understand both sides of the above re: global. Untested new stuff introduces risk for beta, need to deliver global-enabled for launch. 

Doesn't need to be a focus in this moment, but I want to have an outlined plan for how we get from where we are to launch, if only so we can properly articulate to client.
have bones of it already, needs details filled in
(not related to this specific task but in terms of Operations)

Similarly, I'm not sure what hasn't specifically been asked about in any conversations. If there are any other known deltas between beta and final, I'd like for us to outline what we know so we can stay ahead of client relations.
Thanks.
agree will be part of discussions with <@U0B9N0HF0> and <@U02E3CRMA> today.  as well as plans for friday handoff
Thank you.
I need to know ASAP any deltas and our plans/timing to get those to final.

I'd like to test today what would happen if we get a global story entered. Clients will not be prevented from entering global stories in the CMS so even if we enter, test, then delete. That way we won't be surprised or troubleshooting in front of them.

there is a location in the database right now for nigeria, there wasnt a story attached to it, I attached a story to it, and the location showed up in the map api request. looks like the map itself on the front end just ignored it
oh hey cool!
does it react well if you yank it back off and make it US only?
setting focus on zoom is not a big deal and if that is what you want we can do it that way.  it’ll just mean you’ll be all the way zoomed out on load
(i understand that the map glitch is fixable)
it’s not a glitch
i was still talking about peter’s comment that the map ignored the addition of the nigeria
i think the front end might just be parsing the locations in the United States object right now
ignoring any others
<https://net-contributor-dev.appspot-preview.com/api/map/filter/global>
not sure if that is the logic at the moment <@U243UT96G>
that JSON only has US at the moment it seems
the logic atm looks at the US by default - i can change it.  it’s literally 1 line of code
The Nigeria example is helpful, and the other scenario we need to try is a story with no location at all since that's global, which is different from international
<@U243UT96G> thats why i said glitch and not bug
yeah i look out the nigeria location in the data
figured.
i will add it back
there now there is one story there
dope. per <@U0HP6TFNX> above, can someone wire up a “global” one that has no loc
at least so its there to peep and figure out what the interaction should be (basing that off <@U243UT96G> ‘s comments above)
those already exist in the data
wonderful.
looks like quite a few
well, as long as they’re there and someone can eventually test/UX them (not at the moment!) then i’m satisfied that they’re real!

attachments.title: Fsck
attachments.text: The system utility fsck (for "file system consistency check") is a tool for checking the consistency of a file system in Unix and Unix-like operating systems, such as Linux and OS X. A similar command, CHKDSK exists in Microsoft Windows.
